Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The MoMoM data base does not disregard notarisations out of order...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: iut adds them all... then scans a range of them looking for a valid hash

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if the block is rejected, so is the notarization

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes... so it makes it again you think?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and it will be skipped

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the notariser assumes that the notariasation will just be valid and accepted as a transactino

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so if N+1 comes in before N, then N+1 is accepted, N rejected

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then a MoMoM hash will be missing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then the miner will notice block rejected and make a new block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: MoMoM has to handle skipped notarizations

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hmmm... the whole problem with it was that is didnt

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if the block is rejected all tx inside are rejected

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It had to brute force scan a heap of them to find the corect one

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: only way is to test it I guess

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its not ahrd to take the heigh restriction away if ti causes problems

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the notarization tx shouldnt ever get validated, but you need to enforce that and make sure it doesnt come in at a different position in block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this does give the notaries power to invalidate a block

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think its more the miner than notary....

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if miner doesnt include the notarisation... but thats already an issue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: miners can always make invalid blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if notaries make out of order notarization, the miner mines it and it is invalid block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it goes into mempool, then the miner mines it again...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you need to prevent adding it back into the mempool

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this is what Im saying... it would be simpler to just let it be out of order

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its a very very rare case that it happens

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: like 0.5%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, so no need for height check. that wont break any other assumptions?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I dont think so... but this ie earlyt stages... Alright came up with the idea and I figured it would be possible.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Trying to work out how I can add all the code witout actually creating and validating the coins fisrt to see if it can actually work.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: otherwise testing it will be hell... ppl needing to update everty few hours üòÇ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just use a CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: lock all the block 1 coins in the CC

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: or a special chain that allows any coinbase

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the CC allows spending based on whatever rules

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Can we use that to add more couins to the contract to keep the chain going?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: like fauct fund

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: to the notarisation contract

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: create coins out of thin air, requires making a -ac_selfimport type of mechanism

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no not out opf thin air

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but you can always just add more funds to CC

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: just anyone can buy and send coins to the CC address tro "refil it"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont use sendtoaddress!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but using the custom rpc call to send to CC, yes anyone can refill it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: cool this was something I suggested... if it is not too hard it is the way to go as it colves more problems in one go

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i recommend making a cclib.cpp custom CC for this custom spending rules for notary pay

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
CC allows it to be refilled... But its not needed... eg:
tx[1] in block is notarisation verify this as best as possible (check pubkeys of vins? and to RXL address)
tx[0] in this block pays each pubkey X coins from either "thin air" as a comission calcualtion
OR 
tx[0] pays same but from a CC address. 
if notarisation is invalid then block is rejected at very last step.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I 'm leaning more towards CC ... but dont want this taking anouth year üòÖ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: controling exact coin emission by printing coins is much harder.... as notarisations dont happen like clockwork

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what I am saying is that the CC will allow to not have to payout in lockstep in the block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically each valid notarization would earn coins from the CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and they can be spent as soon as the notarization happens

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe a 0.0001 marker utxo can be made each block, which wont affect coin supply much and each one triggers an eligible amount calculation that can be spent by a notary

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if the rules are pretty much set, you can just payout in coinbase and valiate that

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Thew only thing im concerned about with the ac-end is that we dont know exactly how many notarisations will happen in X blocks.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it can only be an average... like expect every 5... so some supply will be burnt as it is not evey 5, but is most of the time.
